DeclarationStatement.Content: By sending this application you agree that:
the information you've given is complete and correct as far as you know
the Carer's Allowance Unit may check your information with other government departments
you'll pay back any money you've been overpaid if you're asked to
you'll report changes of your circumstances or those of the person you care for promptly either online or by contacting the Carer's Allowance Unit
You could be prosecuted or have to pay a financial penalty if you deliberately give wrong or incomplete information or don't report changes. Your Carer's Allowance may also be stopped or reduced.

DisclaimerStatement.Title: This is my claim for Carer's Allowance.
DisclaimerStatement.Content: When you claim Carer's Allowance the person you care for may stop getting:
a severe disability premium paid with their benefits, if they get one
an extra amount for severe disability paid with Pension Credit, if they get one
reduced Council Tax, if their local council offers it
Read more about how Carer's Allowance affects other benefits.
You must tell the person you care for before you claim.

Evidence.Title: You'll get an email when your claim has been received.
You'll usually get a decision on your claim within 4 weeks - it may take longer if you don't send the required documents.
Documents required
Evidence.Content: last payslip you got before 08-04-2016 (your claim date)
any payslips you have had since your claim date
your most recent finalised accounts you have for your business
payslips for Statutory Sick Pay since your claim date
payslips for any statutory payments since your claim date
You can send original documents or photocopies.
Include your name, address and National Insurance number with anything you send.

Consent.QuestionLabel: Do you agree to the Carer's Allowance Unit contacting anyone mentioned in this form?
